snippet.title: Qantas flights return to Sydney after separate issues
snippet.content:
Two Qantas flights have returned to Sydney after they suffered separate issues on international routes.
QF63, on its way to Johannesburg in South Africa, departed Sydney just before 11am and got to Tasmania before it turned back. QF7, heading to Dallas in the United States, departed at 1.40pm and turned around shortly after, circling in the ocean off Wollongong as it dumped fuel.
It is understood one of the planes has a cracked windscreen. More to come The story first appeared on .
